lXxB7SrDonVPXiLgxfnHLQ.text: This Giraffe does have an outstanding location, on the South Bank right by the Thames. While the food is not the most amazing in the world, it does make a very convenient place for a reasonable meal. The first time I ate here was in the late afternoon/early evening, when their special-price two-course meal proved an amazing bargain. Choose from 3 or 4 starters and main courses (all of which appear on the ordinary menu, they're not cheap 'specials') for just under £7; if you're drinking, a lot of cocktails are two-for-one at this time too! However, they did lose points for seaing me at the bar when tables were free - why do solo diners always get shoved here? The second time was with a friend and a young child, and this is where Giraffe probably comes into its own in the daytime. It has a nice children's menu, provides crayons and balloons, and above all the staff are friendly and laid-back. (As a result, Giraffe is popular with families and therefore perhaps best avoided in daytime if you don't have/love being screamed at by toddlers). This branch of Giraffe does its job well then, and while I wouldn't go out of my way just to eat there, it's certainly a great option when you are near one and want something reasonably priced to eat with friendly service.

iBZOrtT_7uUeV8k2KpfPiQ.text: Giraffe was pretty good, we enjoyed ourselves by sitting outside on a beautiful evening but weren't overly impressed with the food. We ordered a chorizo chicken burger that was pretty dry (but good otherwise!!) and our beer battered onion rings never made it to the table. Thus the three stars. That being said, the NACHOS were amazing!! If i were to rate just them, 5 stars across the board as they hit the spot! We both thoroughly enjoyed them and added chorizo into the mix. It was a sliced chorizo that looked like salami which added a lot of flavouring to the whole pile. Beans, corn, cheese and chipotle flavoured tortilla chips made the appetizer a heaping mound of deliciousness. We'd definitely go back to giraffe just to have a few rounds of nachos and some tasty margaritas.

-aQyjvAbvLspLgNYk8s-pw.text: Outstounding location with lovely indoor/outdoor option (al fresco dining!). Really huge space, so you'll never wait long for a table. More a coffee shop vibe than that of a restaurant, but I suppose that tends to fit in with the Giraffe theory anyway. Honestly, I've never been to a Giraffe for anything other than breakfast. I go here when I crave a bit of Americana in the mornings. The pancakes are FANTASTIC - fluffy and perfect covered in wonderful fruit and maple syrup. They offer freshly-made juices and international coffees. The Mexican-style egg tostada is almost one of my favorite dishes - eggs, chorizo, salsa, black beans and cheese grilled on top of a large corn torilla. Usually my husband and I split these 2 dishes, because I can never decide! The Belgian waffles are also very lovely & they do a mean granola! Around £20 for food and coffees/juices for 2, it's not a builder's breakfast, but worth it for a Sunday brunch treat. Always had good service, though occassionally a bit slow if there's not enough staff on.

2FPCoVtIaZzUMQsapqnUuA.text: Really nice view over the thames. Been here for dinner and breakfast - both of which were really nice.For breakfast i had there scrambled egg and salmon with a bagel and dinner i had the Giraffe Burger. The smoothies are really tasty. Well worth a visit.

0s0ur__9mOkXyka4-hyr3Q.text: Though I was initially quite impressed by this chain when it emerged a few years ago- since it expanded the quality of the food and service can vary between branches.I took an 11 year old here for dinner and the service was great despite the fact the restaurant was really busy at the time. The kids' menu is well priced- my companion has a bigger appetite than me so I we ordered one adult burger and one kids' and then did a swap. The burgers, a salad, two drinks and one kids' dessert came to £20 which is reasonable but my burger was burnt and even the adults' portion came with very few fries. I think the food let them down this time.But it's still a great place to bring kids- we didn't feel rushed out of there and the crayons and activity sheet they provided were a useful diversion. As there is a general buzz about the place you can play games etc at your table without disturbing the people around you at all.

w136uewJku8WuDgb5NlXpg.text: I've had a couple of bad experiences with this branch of Giraffe. They appear to market themselves as a family friendly restaurant but a friend was informed by their manager that they aren't family friendly - they are a regular restaurant that allows families. ALWAYS a long wait, often bad service - food is overpriced in my opinion and my friend's family was treated appallingly and made to sit outside in the freezing cold just because their toddler had a tantrum (and who hasn't had that happen to them). I'd skip Giraffe and do Strada or Wagamama's instead!

guEX83WrwNsTuiPiYl4iuA.text: Out of all of the Giraffes I've been to, this one has to be my favourite, mainly for the location. Opening a Giraffe, as well as many other decently priced restaurants in the South Bank, just below Royal Festival Hall, was a brilliant idea as it gives concert and event goers the perfect place for that pre-show dinner. This Giraffe is certainly an excellent choice for such an occasion. There is always a good variety of choices on the menu, suited to most tastes, and the service is usually quite friendly and efficient. There are often special to be found if you register on their website and there is one day in the week (I forget if it's Monday or Wednesday) when wine is buy one get one free, which is well worth it!

kZxVhSwTGaA717gVl28FGA.text: First, I must say I was very grateful for the company of the wonderful friends who took me to Giraffe. In no way did I wish to spoil their evening by complaining. The wine was very welcome, and the view of the Esso Building and South Bank promenaders was wonderful.However. the falfafel :-) First, I foolishy (and selfishly) took the entire piece from the Mezze dish and ate it. Then, feeling queasy, I stopped chewing, and waited until a suitable interval when I could go to the toilet to dispose.I spoke to the kitchen staff, saying I did not wish to make a fuss in front of my friends, but that I had found the falafel unpleasant. I was offered fresh falafel to taste, which I agreed was absolutely fine, but they also conceded there was something very wrong with the falafel on our plate. I was given no explanation, except to find no charge for the Mezze on the bill.So for that, Giraffe, nil points.

U36MnMfTIv6J19821eRpRg.text: I've been here twice and on both occasions came away wondering why, every time I walk past the place, there is a huge queue waiting to get in. Giraffe on the South Bank has an enviable location and they seem to take it for granted that they'll be busy regardless of quality of food or service. On my first visit we didn't even get any food. It was a late night after a visit to the National Theatre and it put a dampener on the whole evening. We were told that they were still open but that we'd have to be quick and we were left standing there for 10 mintes trying to get the attention of any staff members. We left without even getting a table. On our second visit we were with friends who wanted to go so we tagged along. This time we were served but the food was well below par. I had a tortilla wrap which was soggy and stuck to the plate and a friend had a burger which had the just thawed cardboard texture. When there is so much choice along the South Bank I'm at a loss as to why this place is always so busy. Plain food and indifferent service.

EQ7VeyGxAOvXpmIyHRq1Kg.text: I really enjoy all Giraffe restaurants and this one is one of my favourites because of its great location. Set on the South Bank, this is the ideal place to go to for an early dinner or brunch on a Sunday. Talking of brunch, you have to try their pancake stack with blueberries- its amazing! Their lunch and dinner menu is also great, with delicious burgers normally stealing my vote. As with many chains, service can sometimes be a bit impersonal, but I have generally been quite impressed with it on the various occasions I have visited.

czj-pCC8EPgItHif3oaesg.text: We went here with the kids. There was quite a long wait with different people looking after you - all very nice and helpful but confusing. Cocktails were OK with some non-alcoholic versions for the kids.Burgers were pretty tasty and satitisfying. Certainly not 'fine dining' but for a not too expensive meal with the kids it was fine. We sat outside and absorbed the buzz from the South Bank

b-fr9WpQ5mR3mM9XB332kQ.text: Giraffe is a restaurant, coffee shop and bar. Serving breakfast, lunch and dinner and snacks suitable for children and adults alike, although be careful visiting weekend afternoons - I have been caught out twice with very noisy childrens partys - great fun but no good when meeting friends for a chat and catch up! The food is very good with a variety to suit. Portion size is quite large with the possibility of purchasing side dishes if necessary. The staff are very helpful without bothering you. Keen to find you an appropriate table, provide drinks and menus and clear tables quickly. Be prepared to queue, it does get busy and if visiting during peak periods you may need to wait, but I would recommend this - Service and quality excellent and during summer months it is very pleasant sitting outside.

Z8jL0NWzGz1WmkXOHMc_gA.text: My girlfriend brought me here for my birthday, having spent a boozy day laying in the park! We continued the theme by ordering two of their famous cocktails. Their gin berry sling was absolutely phenomenal and had me feeling quite merry after every mouthful! This was followed by a lovely mezze-style plate of starters that we could not fault, and big portions of enchillades for her, with a perfect rib eye steak for me, cooked blue, just how I like it. The service was excellent, not too fussy, but really friendly and ever so cheerful. We'll go back again, but be prepared to queue outside, since it is VERY popular. Well worth the wait though - you'll only be out there for 10 minutes or so.

uv-fyVQxU7EZob5bwYzJlg.text: The Jamaican short ribs had absolutely no flavor and I'm pretty sure the stir fry my wife had and I tried got us  both sick the next day! Great service but awful food at least for us last night!

8g3JpEJ58oZDSlKR_41baw.text: Really mediocre. Beer was warm, food wasn't hot. Slaw was WAY over salted. Much better places to eat in London.

fDCEqBDChFGjYzA94uHaWQ.text: Went for breakfast after an early ride on the London Eye.  Service was good, food was very good.  Smoothies and nice breakfast selections makes this a great stop.  Breakfast served until noon helps also.

dYjD0cn_EayU2bc_CQRedA.text: I usually avoid Giraffe at mealtimes as noisy children and trying to enjoy food just don't go together, but if you come here after bedtime it's actually quite enjoyable.The South Bank is a great hub of activity and after strolling, watching films and appreciating galleries, it's nice to continue the conversation indoors in one of their booths. As a restaurant it's nothing special, but it's good just to come in from the cold and chat over dessert, or a selection of their sides. Giraffe's food is cheap diner-stlye and the decor is a cheap idea too, but the diverse, vibrant ambiance of the area seems to creep in here nicely.Their salads are a bit of a disaster, with each one I've tried being very lacking, but sharing a few dishes from the 'Starters and Nibbles' menu can work out well. By far the best thing on the menu is the Toblerone style cheesecake, if you have the munchies this really hits an untasteful spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

AcoYu7fcUQJJem9ftY3bUQ.text: I had heard of Giraffe before we made our trip across the pond, and marked it as a possible stop due to it's child-friendly nature.  As it happened, we ended up coming here for a dinner and had a good experience.  I'll agree with the gist of many of the reviews here and say that the food wasn't anything special.  It wasn't awful, but it wasn't amazing either.  On the other hand during our visit, the service was very good.  All of the staff were very friendly and actively engaged our 15-month old dining companion, which was definitely not the norm during our UK visit.  For our purposes this was a big plus.Would I recommend Giraffe to people without children?  Probably not, but if you're in the city with a baby in tow and would like a decent meal you could do worse.

2NyR2tGF48RCUmGFm_sKQw.text: While exiting the London eye we got hungry and it started raining so we had to find a food area quick since it was pretty late about 8-9pm. I saw this place and it was packed so we decided to give it a go. Right when we entered someone came out to the post and asked us how many people and seated us away. Someone in our party went the loo. Our waiter came and asked us if we're ready, we said were waiting on someone  to come back from the loo. So, our friend came back and we seriously waited about 15-20 minutes until our waiter came back. We just were hungry and wanted to eat at this point. I ordered the duck sesame noodles. The food came out at a reasonable time. Not once did our waiter came back to see if we needed anything else or how the food was. The food was good. I'm not sure if that's just how London's is with customer service but I think as a customer it should improve.

PLcJuPryNqV_CBvWUoaD8A.text: Our study abroad program chose Giraffe by Waterloo Bridge as our first group orientation dinner location - the food was on them, but the drinks were on us. We all met there after a scavenger hunt across London, and my fellow King's College exchange students and I shared a few drinks at the bar while we waited for the rest of four group to arrive. I tried a South African cider that was very good, but kind of pricey.I passed by the restaurant quite often as it was very close to King's College London's Strand campus, and it was ALWAYS packed. Probably with tourists. It was a good choice for large groups because the seating arrangements were very flexible (they could just push tables together), but the restaurant wasn't anything special. Our server had to deal with a huge group with lots of special requests, but he was a good sport about it. Giraffe reminded me of all the typical American chain restaurants and served pretty typical American chain restaurant-type food. Even though I thought the name and design was cute, I never felt the urge to eat at another Giraffe while I was in London. It just wasn't that memorable of an experience.

p1rnI6r9lvzYSECNHIGUFg.text: Right along the river, gorgeous view! Ok service, none of them seemed too happy to be at work but you gotta suck it up and do your job. First walking up and looking at the menu, I didn't know if the man who greeted me actually worked there or was just friendly. he wasn't wearing anything that showed me that he did indeed work there. He was quite nice and I was told of a 15min wait for outside and was seated in about 6min. I had the soup of the day, some sort of spicy Mexican bean soup. Wasn't spicy, rather bland had to add salt, pepper and tabasco. Also had the chicken pot stickers. Again nothing to write home about. Burgers looked amazing at the other table so I would say try one of those.Originally was going to give it a 2 but they weren't rushing anyone to leave quickly and when asked for something I promptly received it.Probably wouldn't return unless I hear more from someone else.

rK4mAZ90b0og6r_Zj86QBA.text: I thought they might do a decent breakfast.I thought they might and I was wrong. Not a fan of Giraffe by some distance. If I had several offspring and several off road prams then this 'fun' looking diner might meet my needs. But as a selfish adult this place just pissed me off. Not that we were overpowered by screaming young folk. No we made our way early to Giraffe to sample some old fashioned breakfast delights. It started with bad service progressed to the point where they delivered my wifes food but realised my order had been forgotten and ended with my food delivered late and so eaten after my other half had finished. Honestly what did I think of all that. I could not possibly say what I honestly thought at the time. Giraffe is child friendly and child popular. All other humans should go else where.PS this is a restaurant not a music venue as it's listing says.

gCER7H4P2lkMvWQbxRBArQ.text: Increasing consensus on Giraffe is "it's not as good as it used to be" and I would support that. The Giraffe has had babies and spread out all over London. The menu is lively and different but quality has suffered because of their expansion.I really used to enjoy their falafel burger with halloumi and coriander but someone went and changed the recipe. Pity! They do a good veg and feta salad with quinoa and avo as well as a roasted pumpkin, spinach and endamame bean salad. Because its child friendly, it's often quite chaotic and they also add service to the bill which is unwarranted on quite a few occasions.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

U1vi1IxKw4spZpC58ShVcA.text: Dinner wasn't great or any of us (3 people). We ordered 2 Katsus and pasta from the menu. Neither of them was great. However, the service was really good and the waiter was very nice to us. Wouldn't recommend tho, this is mainly because the quality of the food is way under the price you are paying. On the positive part: good location and nice atmosphere.

4w4uAfcBo3VxFez177W5eA.text: Possibly the worst restaurant  I've eaten in for a long time. The food was mediocre and that's being kind. I had garlic bread for a starter that consisted of chunks of lightly toasted bread dumped in a green sludge, which I hope was garlic. The main course was unimpressive (so much so that I've forgotten what I had) and it was far too pricey for what we got as well as the amount of time spent waiting for a table.I won't be going back.

DvRZWBqMjTQOCDdO2PvVpg.text: I went a couple of weeks ago and was impressed. We were seated in 15 minutes on a very busy Saturday and managed to get seats outside which in the sunshine is absolutely divine. Our food was perfectly reasonable in price and the waiting staff were very attentive and friendly. Once sat we didn't feel pressured or that any table turning was taking place. For a Saturday afternoon lunch on the Southbank I found Giraffe to be more than adequate.

uhWvgNCNX97pKWXr-3V0Ew.text: Ate here before heading to the globe and it was immense. A great menu made even better by great service and an amazing location. You will more than likely have to queue but it does move fast just like everything else in london. There's a lot of options around here to eat and this always is busy, the masses cannot be wrong.......can they???

1HFbl1zj6XX8rUIrTlotVw.text: How we ended up here again I blame on tiredness, apathy and to escape far too many children on South Bank. A ridiculous notion we discovered. I am honestly baffled at how Giraffe has turned into such a successful chain, because the food is a total waste of calories. The hummus was beyond bland, the crudités just sad and they couldn't even seem to manage decent nachos.  Packed full of screaming kids and someone in the kitchen incomprehensibly rattling cutlery throughout our meal, the atmosphere was rowdier than the playground of a Maccy D's. Our absent-minded waitress wandered away after taking our drink order and didn't reappear for a very  long time. Giraffe, eh pass.

9-H1HWkBKHR9SNgaNkpdDA.text: I am usually a fan of Giraffe restaurants - I love the food and fun atmosphere. But my recent experience at the Giraffe on the South Bank wasn't great. Bad service in general. Different staff were forgetting anything we asked for and tables, floor and toilets were rather grimey. I have been to Giraffe in Richmond and Clapham and both were great!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

2jtmY5i4Ln3YdkyArr2Rtg.text: Full post and photos @ thecattylife.com  Giraffe is a chain of groovy restaurants around London - I especially love the Southbank branch on a bright sunny day. I'm usually there for breakfast/brunch and the menu is fabulous. Make sure you try one of their excellent fruit smoothies!

oEWyvGNv0zWnB5LziZr8Ew.text: Not overly impressed, to be honest. One of those cheeky chains that will ride on their brand rather than trying to create a good experience every time for each customer. The food's alright, usual giraffe menu, nothing amazing and verging on being over-priced. The wine I was recommended tasted like nail varnish remover. Which was a shame, really, as I needed something to wash down the dry wedges, which, might I add, were not what I ordered, but they 'forgot' to tell me they had run out of my first choice. Cheers. Not only that, but they do that sneaky thing where they very kindly add themselves on an 'optional' 12.5% service charge. I opted to remove that and just pay the bill. Ducks to avoid flying insults

InsbEFEUn7qpifX3Te2qag.text: This restaurant is completely average. I came here with a big group of people, and it's good for many different tastes. It's definitely something I would get in the States. So I suppose in that sense, it's kind of a refreshing return to familiarity. It's pretty much American fusion with a number of ethnic foods, and there is definitely something for everyone. I don't have any qualms about it, but it just didn't stand out to me as being as innovative as it makes itself out to be.

ZYgHaRfUhWMo5HLa5vY4NA.text: Giraffe boasts to carry foods from around the globe "because giraffes are so tall they have a different view of the world". Well I don't think they can see to far because the food at Giraffe is pretty basic, the best thing on the menu are the burgers, but they are happy to cater to people with food allergies, vegans, and vegetarians. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and have a selection of smoothies which is novel in a London restaurant. It boasts to have a family atmosphere, so be prepared for kids. It is a little overpriced for the style of food but then it is on the Southbank in London among other heavy traffic areas.     It it is a sunny day I would recommend sitting outside under the umbrellas.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

uxrQAovtd5v_j3Fs1KONMQ.text: This place was good. Nothing memorable, but we did feast out and didn't have many complaints. The sandwich I got was really hard to eat, stuff falling out everywhere, but it was satisfying. We shared a whole bunch of stuff, shrimp, hummus, fries and enjoyed it all. The place was busy. I had a beer called Curious Brew, which I really liked. It is like a beer & champagne hybrid. Super bubbly and refreshing as we were starving and exhausted from sightseeing all day.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

LtEGiXQCWKgFJrKLiHyc7g.text: Welcome babies!!!  This was the only place open when my friend and I were wandering towards the Tate Modern from London Eye. It was 11.30 and we were starving. Mistake. When we entered there were a few kids here. We asked for a booth and were seated fairly quickly. And then we sat and waited for 14 minutes before anyone so much as greeted us or brought us water. At 14 minutes I asked someone if we should leave or if they had someone working our table...I tried to be polite but the place was filling up.The menu was nice and I like the gluten free menu choices. Soo nice. We decided to stay. The food came quickly and it was fine...nothing special but good. By this time we were surrounded by kids..kids everywhere which would be fine if I wasn't on vacation for the first time without my 2.5 year old. But that not anyone's fault but my own...I realize that.  I think the waitress came by and did ask how our food was and we said it was fine but that we needed the bill. I was disappointed. This is the worst place we've eaten in London and we didn't leave the suggested tip amount which I have never in my life done. Terrible service. Friendly for kids and good location but I'd have been better off waiting for one of the other restaurants nearby to open at noon.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

CA_S0tQGgK3eWgncKspqbg.text: Oh it's another franchise!  Came here on Sunday out of convenience.  Been here before, know the menu, know what I like.  But wait...they've changed the menu?  Doesn't look quite as appetizing as it did before - healthy, hearty, big portions and easy on the wallet.  Nope!  Portions smaller and didn't nearly provoke enough salivation!  I had the burrito which was completely bland.  The chips I had on the side were more enjoyable than the main - now that's saying something!It's popular with familes, so there's lots of children and it's very noisy.The staff are fun and flirty though.  And they do a pretty good Mojito! Sadly, I won't be too inclined to go there again after this last experience.

RAWlydg4EyKCDNiaUHkI9w.text: I came here for a cheap lunch with my boyfriend.  We sat outside to bask in the rare London sun and be by the river.  The location is amazing, on South Bank overlooking the water.  However, the food wasn't really that great and the service was lacking.I ordered a cheeseburger with sweet potato fries.  My cheeseburger wasn't warm and tasted quite bland.  However, the sweet potato fries were great!  Flavourful, crispy and tasty.All in all, I think next time I try to find a cheap eat off of NUS card, I'll go somewhere else.

o0NJmbWE2qL69DIgRkOQZQ.text: Looked online at the many restaurants in the area. Decided to eat here with my Mum. The place was very busy. The wait wasn't too long to get a table. The food was very good. My meal cost around £12.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken breast with mushrooms, cheese, bbq sauce with an onion ring.
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Rodeo chicken sandwich

kS_wD5UJtH19XSu0VVzdeg.text: This was the first meal of many when arriving to London for my bf and I. I have to say the lemonade was delicious and the burger was very yummy and non greasy.

-kucsqzGFpqPiMPHVA0zIQ.text: One of the worst meals that I've had since living in London.  Terrible I.P.A.  Terrible Falafel burger.  Terrible sweet potato fries.  Terrible Rioja.  This place is not managed well enough to operate on this large of a scale.  The restaurant is enormous and service was lacking.  I've been to other locations in and outside of London, locations that I'd give 3 stars, but this location was just unacceptable in terms of food and service.  Sadly, restaurants like these stay afloat on account of location and nearby tourism.

YSuUw1hsaXvFtvSrSENokA.text: After seeing on their website that they had banana pancakes(american stly ones, not the thin ones we get here in the Netherlands I couldnt wait to try them, so I went there during my visit in March.The restaurant was rather empty when I arrived, and I ordered a mint tea, a smoothie and the banana pancakes. Unfortunately when they arrived it wasn't what I had been expecting. The pancakes where rather dark and dry, my local supermarket sells much better ready made ones. The bananas where just a but less ripe as I would have hoped, I like them overly ripe in food(they are delicous on brown bread or bun with only a bit of butter)As for the smoothie I hadn't expected to be that much ice in it, which for me meant a less enjoyable drink.In conclusion It was a bit disappointing overall and I'm afraid I wont be going back...

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Dark&dry banana pancake, smoothie, mint tea

Ig4a04aMuju1HiwaFA9Xig.text: I mean I wouldn't say this place is bad, but I wouldn't choose to go again unless we were in the predicament that led us here - thinking Saturday night was a good time for a large group to go to Wahaca. Sadly they had over an hour wait while Giraffe was about 15 minutes for 9 of us, and we were all hungry, so on we went.I'm sure there are some good things on the menu but my own food was really uninspiring. The burger was dry and uninteresting, chips were fine but nothing special. I could have gotten better for the same price elsewhere. The service was pretty slow and we waited way too long for our check in the end. A few of my friends did like their meals though, so maybe I'm just being harsh. But there's just so much around London that's better, I feel like going to mediocre chains is a waste of time.

yxzG7VilcZSSbn1nm2-skQ.text: I used to like Giraffe, unpretentious tasty food and a healthy amount of it. However, my latest visit was distinctly disappointing. Maybe I just don't like the venue; this Southbank branch feels like a frenzied feeding factory where customers are just units who require nutrient injections. It is busy, too loud and too stuffy. I had dishes from the Feel Good Dinner Menu, and I think it should be renamed the Feel Meh Dinner Menu. The starter of sticky sesame wings was mediocre, and the main of Katsu Japanese pork schnitzel was just the wrong combination. It was too salty and mixing crispy schnitzel with soup noodles doesn't make any sense, becoming sodden and floppy like sticks of brown meat sponge. The dessert of chocolate eclair cake was agreeable, but as a choux pedant, there was nothing eclair about it. A profiterole maybe but eclair is misleading. The service was bizarre too. The waiter lingered at our table for far too long. Awkward banter is one thing but once that is out of the way, standing there pointlessly while we stare at him to leave is definitely off-piste in terms of waitering. He'd then saunter over to the bar, turn his back, bow his head, and prod away at something at waist level. There were clearly people around us wanting service. He did this several times. He's either checking for unusual lumps down below, or prattling away on his phone, both of which are unacceptable in my books. £17 for this experience was far too much and I think I'll be giving this branch, and this chain, a wide berth next time round.

b7Nvx0kIn3jNrO9MhmmMxw.text: Visited this restaurant because we were in the area and the large restaurant was packed.  We thought that since it was so busy, the food had to be good..  3 stars because of the waiter.  We ordered the ribs, beef burrito, steak sandwich with fries, and jambalaya.  Maybe its because we are from the US but the food was barely acceptable.  I was hungry and was having a hard time trying to eat it.  The cost wasn't cheap (comparing the price in USD) either.  The saving grace was our waiter who was actually concerned that we didn't like the food.  She tried her best and because of her I didn't give this restaurant 1 star.

DJm-cPjGLOKYD6Hzl5KCQA.text: Hmmm...another chain eatery on this trip.....(9/27/13). I hadn't realized that or I would gotten my hopes up like the Pret a Manger experience (4 star).Six people in our including two twin 4 year old toddlers. Yes, very kid friendly, you can tell right at the front door when you look to the right and see a load of, uh, hmm, push chairs (have to get used to the fact they are not called strollers here! lol). Place was loud and crowded on a Friday night but that didn't deter us since we came to expect a superb dining experience.Damn well that didn't happen. it was simply satisfactory but not awful. Melon margarita was okay, not really tasty enough in terms of the melon but there was alcohol so that is always good. Coconut shrimp appetizer was good with a nice spicy sauce to dip in the shrimp. Kids however didn't take to it (strange, see Bao review), Our little girl didn't like her pizza which was a bit strange, strips of bread, with some tomato sauce and melted cheese on it. Our little boy did however like his pasta and downed most of it, the little remainder his sister finished, cool! Others had the fish (no comments) and  spicy lentil soup which was "very good", salad which seemed okay. Oh, yeah, I had the jambalaya with seafood. An okay dish, maybe 2 1/2 start dish. Wasn't great but wasn't bad either. Oh, I guess that adds up to mediocre, right? So conclusion? I thought it was a disappointing experience since given its location, prices, crowd and noise there would be more substance to the food. Oh, well, live and learn.

OTyN4OYzR1uKWOQguBA7ow.text: I am surprised to see the reviews of Giraffe. I stayed down the way at the Marriott County Hall and walked the shops along the Thames each day. Friday evening I stopped in Giraffe for an evening dinner and was in time to order the "Giraffe Time Menu" which provided a starter & an entree for 8.45 £. There were three of us in our party - two ordered the daily soup (carrot & coriander) and the English Burger with fries. I ordered the hummus with warm naan and the farmer's market vegetable burrito. Arriving at that time I also was able to take advantage of the Bar Buddies which offered certain drinks at 50%. I ordered the acacia tree white wine from South Africa for 2.17£, The drinks arrived first and the wine was excellent. Sweet and refreshing. The soup arrived with focaccia bread. I did have a sample and I thought it was wonderful - of course it was also bone-chillingly cold outside, so the warm soup was a welcome relief. The hummus and naan was also good. When the main entrees arrived, we could barely eat it all. The burgers were large and the fries excellent. The vegetable burrito was huge and well-stuffed, topped with lettuce, cucumber and radish, and a sauce that set it off right. The decor was very cool and the staff polite and helpful. The dinner was so nice, we returned for Sunday afternoon lunch. Without a discount menu to choose from today, we ordered from the lunch menu, which also included brunch until 4pm. One person in the group ordered barbeque chicken & cheddar quesadilla, another chicken, bacon & brie on a baguette with fries, and I went with the brunch menu and chose the full breakfast. At only 7.75£, the later provided a great bang for the buck - 3 slices of multi-grain toast, baked beans, fries, 2 fried eggs, a sausage and some country ham. The Friday meal was about 36£, and today was just over 32£ - not bad for three people, I thought. I enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant, the friendly staff, the food and the area. I would say I would go back, but obviously I did in returning for lunch today. One good experience I might consider it a fluke based on the other reviews, but with two visits and two good experiences, I can't say that. I enjoyed my visits here and next time I am in London I would definitely stop by this location or another Giraffe.

kMcMxB4Nsg20kdmlihn-5A.text: We stumbled upon this restaurant by accident! Giraffe is situated on the South Bank alongside a select few other restaurants. It was very busy but we were seated within fifteen minutes. Service was quick and there was a large range of food on the menu. I had the steak which was ok but not worth the price. They serve large sides which is a bonus. Overall good experience.

TZXQ8m8IB6l7d0Sz0_vEBA.text: Went here with friends afterwork. Very much enjoyed the cocktails and reasonably priced.  Food was also good, I recommend the burger and sweet potato fries! Only down side was the slow service. This giraffe is very big and often full to the brim with people therefore we got a little forgotten by the staff. This might be because we were in the outside area.

3BGjGywh1rWhzoZcOr8TkA.text: This Giraffe location is huge, but has a smaller menu selection that the usual smaller locations. Good service, but quite slow. Very loud and a bit cramped, but the food was up to the usual standard. Yum!

5PCeDsZVUX6zC__5NtI0Ig.text: Chain restaurant with chain prices, but on the South Bank so great views!Wide variety of food, reasonable prices.Strange tendency not to use plates I received a sandwich on a breadboard. Weird.

5ukIuycV777PRZ_AKR-FTw.text: Oh my goodness. After a freezing yet satisfying first time on the eye, my girlfriend and I were famished. So we looked up and down the lane by the eye and looked for what looked good, I am picky, and what was even open at 11 am. We popped into Giraffe and man, we should've kept walking. My gf and I both love giraffes and too it as a "sign" that we had to eat here and they still served breakfast so it all should've been a plus. We were say down by the short pixie style blonde and then that was it. I am not joking, that was it. We say and waited for fifteen minutes, with no greet, no water, no "hi I'll be right with you"

3nvzNmVqkhZ299fJjwhQFw.text: REASONABLE FOOD. OK SERVICE. POOR SEATING.Giraffe, despite its name, is not a children's restaurant - although it is very suitable for children. I took a group of 12 adults for lunch here. Firstly, they noted my booking name down wrong so it took a short while before we could sit down. It's times like these that you do wish places would employ good English speakers to take down bookings and to sort things out when they go wrong.The size of the table they provided us with was not adequate for 12 adults and we uncomfortably squeezed together. I don't like it when restaurants put their own greed ahead of the comfort of their customers and this was certainly true, especially when you combine the too small table with the child size seats that may look funny at first but aren't later when your legs start hurting.The menu was varied and interesting to all ages. Our waitress quickly got us some drinks and the service was quite brisk - polite but not friendly. Everyone got what they ordered. The food was not amazing but generally OK and no-one thought it was bad.Overall, an OK experience that would have been much, much better if they were more realistic on the body dimensions of adults.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

JQIlywsODeHLaoSF56DPpQ.text: Pretty standard food - as we arrived at 10pm the staff were preoccupied with closing and we had to try quite hard to summon them to order/get the bill/pay the bill

bwHt760xpo4o0NFQdI9iBA.text: I decided to have lunch here with a friend and was somewhat skeptical at first, from previous experiences I find restaurants that do a wide range of different cultural foods usually cook the food at a mediocre level. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at giraffe, I ordered the sirloin at medium-well and the steak was cooked perfectly and had delicious juices flowing from it with every cut. The garlic butter complimented the flavours of the beef, making it moist as it melted in my mouth. It was incredibly aromatic and flavoursome. I underestimated the green salad, it did not taste as plain as it looks. It was very refreshing and the dressing made it very tasty, a great way to cleanse the palate. The olives I had for starters where scrumptious, I like how they had a range of olives, that were deliciously tangy.Service was excellent, the waitress was very quick and attentive with our orders. The price was fair the bill came to about £50.00 for the both of us. Overall, no complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Healthy green salad
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Sirloin steak goes excellently with garlic butter
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Olives, very juicy with a slight tang.

Q20z8lKxAbE97Tf_qmceng.text: The Giraffe on Southbank is one of the less impressive of the chain. We came on a Sunday afternoon. Earlier we tried to book a reservation but they don't do reservations on the Weekend. The wait was 25 minutes and we mentioned that we had to leave within 45mins. It took a long time before we could order our food. We were in view of several staff who were standing around talking to themselves. The out of 3 food orders only one was correct, and one had to be sent back. The food was nothing special but not bad either. We did however got the incorrect food taken off the bill. Which was a nice touch.

JFBNnHATTk3S5MBoNV46Cg.text: This is the first '2 star' review I've ever given and the only reason it gets 2 is because one of the waitresses was quite friendly (but only one) and because there's outdoor seating. But I wouldn't go back - no way - and nor would I recommend this place to anyone.I ordered a salmon salad and the salmon was frozen! It came with potatoes that tasted like flour and it was drenched in a mustard dressing that didn't complement any flavour. I specifically asked for dressing on the side and it came on top :( But I didn't send it back as it took ages to arrive.My friend had a chicken and mango salad. Sounded tasty on the menu but came with a dressing that tasted disgusting. Apparently it was tequila dressing. Who puts tequila flavoured dressing on a salad??? We're not Ozzy Osbourne!Took ages for food to arrive and ages to get the bill - I was in a bad mood by the time we left and I normally like to leave a restaurant in a better mood than when I entered. Rubbish!

KDixE9C4bPDB_S3IPQjUXw.text: First visit here and must say extremely impressed with the set up and the food. Three of us visited the set up down on the South Bank of the Thames in London one Saturday for brunch and had great Mexican food. Founded in Hampstead in 1998 by Juliette Joffe, Russel Joffe and Andrew Jacobs,Giraffe was owned by its founders, with additional financial backing from private shareholders, 3i investment group and chairman Luke Johnson. 3i invested £10 million in the company in 2006, in a deal that valued the chain at about £24m

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Plenty of outside space

ofgw9hHMwuY0Lu5ek3DIkA.text: Amazing experience with really flavorful food! Started off with one of the best Nachos I have ever had as the technique of slightly roasting the chips does wonders. The mains were simply a delight. Special mention to the Katsu noodles as it served a wonderful amalgamation of various cuisines together. The blend of crispy chicken, Chipotle sauce, Asian Katsu noodles and coriander gave it the right mix of Western and Eastern  cuisines.To top it up the service was great and the pricing is pretty reasonable compared to other places on the Southbank!Will be back to try more soon!

XgbSQzfPh82TSJLsXgIRDA.text: We came here as a group of 30 people (team lunch) and the food came out really, really quickly. I ordered the no-bun falafel burger, which came with 5-6 falafel balls, a side salad (mixed greens and grains) and 2 sauces. It was falafel, nothing special but I liked the taste of side salad. Also, everyone seemed to be happy with their meal choices so it is another plus. I'm giving them 4 stars because they processed our group and food really quickly and the serving team was nice, not because the food was above average. If you have a team something coming up and in need of a place, Giraffe is a good option.

IA1CODnEybZw5SpmfLoTdQ.text: This is an OK place. Everything I have had here has been OK, nothing to talk about but definitely not bad. I have had the burger with fries, their Mediterranean platter, the no bun veggie falafel burger and the full English breakfast. The good thing about this place is that they have healthy options and the food doesn't taste bad at all. Also the service is always friendly and quick. If you are in the area and want a meal that isn't too fancy or pricey I would pick this place.

wwv4QBcGLrr81WVQDBIC6Q.text: Great place for a casual lunch.  We were looking for a good kid friendly place for lunch.  Giraffe has a great selection for kids and parents. My sons chicken breast came with veggies he would eat (lettuce) plus French fries.  My salad was delicious as was the Bloody Mary.  I asked for it very spicy and they did not disappoint.  Service is friendly and quick.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

BiCjEmwG5SuUOTR2hcN_2w.text: I use to go to Giraffe all the time for a Saturday and Sunday late lunch. My meal was the Mexican Breakfast. In the last few year, since they've been bought by Tesco's., there attention to detail and quality has dramatically dropped.The Waterloo  store (which was where I was today) was particular bad on the food side. My meal was cold and even though I ordered a strong coffee, it was extremely weak. Usually the wait staff is a highlight at Giraffe, though our waiter tried disagree with us there there wasn't a glutton free option for an order my friend made, even though it was clearly stated on the menu.  Massive fail. I really would have like to given Giraffe full stars, though, sadly, I feel their service and food is going in the wrong direction. If you can find another option to eat in the area, go there instead of Giraffe.

g0mf8BS7XPM96-wKgSS8eg.text: Meeting some friends in the pouring rain by Waterloo, you want to go somewhere quickly. Knowing the friends I was with, that somewhere had to have drinks of all varieties and be close. So, not having decided beforehand (always a mistake to 'spontaneously' find somewhere when in a group), we gave in and plumped for a chain. Never anything too special, but a nice option. Side point, describing something as nice may possibly be the most politically non-descript thing you can say; it wasn't worth commenting on but you sound like you're being positive. Ick!We got in just before 7pm so found 50% off certain drinks. Making the most of it, I tried a mango and lime daiquiri and an apple and elderflower martini. The former was better as it tasted like fruit was used to make it, the latter was diluted apple juice frankly. We also got some nibbles, worth a try are the quesadillas - the remainder of the food menu is overpriced.3 stars over 2 for convenience and half price drinks, I would likely make a plan first to go somewhere a bit more special.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. A selection of cocktails to start the evening

A6aHc9pT9CyqLMt8GDMKUw.text: We booked a table for 10 to celebrate my best friend's birthday a couple of weekends ago. In the end 16 people turned up. The staff were very good in finding more chairs to accommodate the extra six and made us all very welcome.As for the food, we ordered everything on the menu and they were all very well cooked. I don't think we had one complain from the guests. Would go to Giraffe again when I'm in the area.

t-jeot01eHzF0xkSlpaVuw.text: An overexcited bunch of us stopped in here for a late evening feed after having a few drinks nearby. It's the biggest outpost of this crowd-pleasing chain that I've been in - with the volume levels to match! Sadly we were seated in a booth in the very furthest corner so couldn't enjoy the river views - but we weren't complaining, more just happy to get a seat. We got the feed we were after - I can't say it was particularly inspiring or exciting, but it did the job in satisfying some of the fussier eaters I was with. My burger was ok and the sweet potato fries delicious (can always rely on them!). Annoyingly we'd missed their half price 'bar buddies' cocktails time pre 7pm but maybe that's something for next time. The service was a little flustered as you'd expect given the number of people in there and one of our orders arrived about 5mins later than all the other mains. It was tough to get their attention too but that might've had more to do with being seated in a back corner. Nothing unforgiveable then - but nothing to make me rush back either.

Hje_gLDcUD-YOfPR7cU8zg.text: I'm here from the US (Georgia) and always looking for spots to eat that are close. This was near my hotel and thought I would try it. At best it was mediocre. I had the quesadillas. It was BBQ chicken. Actually, it was not very good. I've had much better at US restaurants. The chicken was shredded and not a lot of taste. I prefer some crunch in the tortillas and they were actually soggy. I may be back to try something else, not overly impressed.

XKclMrA0Mymw9q-oHPmbOQ.text: Excellent calamari. fabulous spaghetti really really great duck noodles dish and amazing friendly service really great family dining experience. Waffle banana desert was amazing too. Curry dish was spicy but not well balanced.

Y1ApnKsMm-Epr5vVvyfkwA.text: Visiting London a few days ago and after walking along the river we decided we were pretty hungry and needed to grab a bite.  They have a menu posted outside which was nice, it let us get an idea of offerings before we put our name on the list. Pretty big menu that was very diverse. We sat down and were greeted by a smiling server named Hogi (sp) she was friendly and very helpful. We ordered our drinks and found out they were buy one get one free and after our 10 hour flight that seemed like a magical idea. Food was good, we got steak and being from the states it wasn't my favorite but a little salt and pepper made it better. The drinks were great, try the strawberry mule! 5 stars is for service, it was a very welcome first night in London.

5uv2oBP1yCnX3P42lIBdjg.text: Had a breakfast burrito which was cheap, but wasn't that great.  It wasn't definitely wasn't spicy enough.  I would skip breakfast here.  Maybe lunch/dinner are better.

1g2eOf2h_lKonEkoMYc3Hw.text: The food was quite exquisite and if it was an option I would give a 4.5 stars. The service was okay but you can't really get much better in London. There is no A/C so it can get quite warm and it doesn't help that the water is served without ice. They were very kind to bring us a cup of ice though. The chicken schnitzel was very good along with all the burgers made from cows right here in London. Also, at the end of the meal they give you really cool complementary plastic giraffes. If you are in downtown London, it is definitely a place you should try for good food and not too high of a cost!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. 3 amazing words engraved on a condiment holder
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Free plastic giraffes
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. The delicious chicken schnitzel

BhaLhUFIXjzzwTHKMprLtQ.text: I popped into the Southbank branch of Giraffe following a recording of 'Have I got News for You' at the ITV television studios. It was rather late- almost 22:00- and we were desperate for dinner, so we were pleased that the restaurant was still busy and we easily got a good booth seat. I have been to several branches of Giraffe across London over the years (even the days before it was bought out by Tesco) and have visited this branch before. The Southbank branch is admittedly my least favourite because it is expansive and always filled to capacity due to its location- I've had incidents there where I have been waiting lengthy periods of time for my server who was desperately attempting to explain the menu to non-native English speakers! So, yes, expect a mostly tourist crowd here.On this visit, the service was very sluggish as it was towards the end of the evening- it took some time to get drinks, our food and our bill. Items were brought over to our table that we didn't order and side items that we did order were delayed and came some time after our mains. It was a bit frustrating when we saw our meals walk past us several times before they were placed in front of us (we were famished)! Our server was friendly (and dramatically mispronounced 'quinoa', bless him).  The Giraffe menu always has some of the same 'favourite' dishes and a few new additions depending on the season. It prides itself on offering a good selection of International dishes, such as: thai curries, jambalaya, mezze, a good selection of burgers, peri-peri chicken, burritos and grills. It has a great selection for vegetarians and even gluten-free options are clearly marked on the menu.I ordered the 'bunless' burger with a grilled chicken breast on a bed of quinoa salad with salad leaves, avocado, tomato and a burger sauce on the side. I usually enjoy the bunless burger salad on offer at the Burgers and Cocktails spin-off sister restaurant, but this version isn't as satisfying- it was colourful and fresh, but a little dry and I found myself adding hot chili sauce for a kick of flavour. The 'burger sauce' was a non-descript pink creamy concoction that I didn't particularly like. It is a good light option, but was missing any bold flavours. I saw the Global Mezze Platter pass our table and it looked absolutely delicious (I had been tempted to greedily order this sharing platter for myself, as I am always happy with mezze).My boyfriend had the Mexican burger- a new addition to the Giraffe menu with chicken and chorizo alongside traditional Mexican accompaniments. It came with hand-cut fries and he ordered more wedges on the side (again, we were famished). I was disappointed that the wedges didn't come with a dipping sauce and he resorted to the ketchup on the table.They were still seating people as it approached 23:00 and it took us ages to get our bill and pay, so it was a bit of a frustrating end to the meal.This is my least favourite branch of Giraffe, so I would recommend it only if you are meeting near Waterloo or stuck on the Southbank. Our Picturehouse membership card worked here and we got a 20% discount off the meal (even the server was surprised, as they do not always accept all discounts and vouchers at this branch). The service is not up to the usual standard of Giraffe due to the busy location and the amount of tables. The service was slow and our food was slightly cold when it finally arrived because of the various delays.I would recommend this branch for families, as they do cater very well to children and have a good kids menu and prices are very reasonable, especially if you are eligible for a Picturehouse or NUS discount. The food always looks attractive and vibrant on the plate and there is a range of healthy, vegetarian, gluten free choices. The standard across the Giraffe restaurants is also fairly consistent, but do try another location if you can!

RzgwxaaC0wMwbrhhFl0d7g.text: Food wise ... its okayyyyyyyy ... nothing to call your grandma about who happens to live in Kentucky.. the waiters are friendly and polite and the venue is alright also .. I mean overall it isnt a memorable spot at all to be honest lol  ... I will tell you that it was rather loud! I'm talking boombox in your uncle's living room loud but if thats your thing then drop on by

ejnvPdCyujt7C9Xc8y1Spg.text: I had brunch at Giraffe on Southbank with a few girlfriends a few weeks ago and had a delicious meal. From my vegetarian "Full English" (which came with avocado, potato wedges and vegetarian sausages) to my friend's banana pancakes served with bacon and maple syrup, we all had a fantastic meal with great service from the staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Pancakes with banana, blueberry compote, bacon and maple syrup
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Vegetarian Full English with avocado and potato wedges

0K4BEVBpD528MrsCvxqAkQ.text: Giraffe seemed as good a place as any to stop for a late breakfast while exploring London. It was cloudy and a bit on the cool side but we sat on the patio because it was a nice view of the surrounding area.The Bacon and Eggs from their Happy Brekkie £5.00 menu seemed like the right deal. Although I prefer my bacon cooked a little more, it was a good breakfast and a good cup of coffee.The rest of their menu features cuisines from all over the world, including Asian, American, Indian, Mexican, Turkish, and more. Interesting or confusing? Hmmm...Overall, the service was good. The washrooms and the rest of the place was clean. Prices were very reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

ARoyPyn9YLgylHCMxsPc3A.text: Seated us and then were completely ignored for 15 minutes before we finally left in disgust.

uC6gJaHjov307S1zEJkJvA.text: The madness they call Giraffe is a chain of restaurants that cater to families, very reminiscent of the Rainforest Cafe. We dined here with 4 adults and 3 toddlers on a cold day. I mention the cold because the queue to dine was a long line outside, wrapped around the restaurant! Ironically, when we were ready to be seated, we opted to sit outside because we had already been outside for 20 odd minutes, why not get to eating instead of waiting even longer for an inside table?! Plus, there were space heaters so that made it a lot more tolerable. The menu offered all different kinds of cuisine (which may or may not be a good thing). I decided to have steak and chips and an espresso martini (hey, I'm on holiday). The rest of the group had ribs, burger, burrito, and the kids had spaghetti, burger, chicken strips (all from the kid's menu). Strangely, they ran out of fish & chips on this day...My steak and chips was cooked a perfect medium. This American would've preferred A1 sauce instead of brown sauce (this wasn't a high-end filet, after all) but even without any sauce, it had a nice flavor to it. Espresso martini had just enough of a caffeine and alcohol kick to it, this was good. Service was super friendly but kind of chaotic. A place like that, what with kids and balloons and crying babies, it's to be expected. While I wouldn't be in a rush to return on my own, it's a good place to take your kids. No one will care if they are acting up or screaming/crying, and they have alcohol.

MFA5WgywFAtw-pUTpNM88g.text: Do NOT eat here. I had the San Fran Super Salad with extra chicken and ended up getting an extra helping of PARASITIC FOOD POISONING. It was on day 2 of a weeklong trip. I battled a 6 hour fever where I could barely crawl and the lingering effects (of which I will spare you the gory detail but involved being in proximity of a bathroom at all times) lasted for the rest of my trip. It's been 2 weeks and I am still on meds as I attempt to recover. I know this is what made me sick because I was traveling with my friend and this was the only significant difference in our dining that day. He had a burger and fries. I thought I took the high road by getting a salad, but ended up paying the price. I repeat: DO NOT EAT HERE.

m_8T-TsUnOfTHOqyP6fIHg.text: Came here for lunch and got the giraffe burger. Very filling but not very flavorful. The fries were very crispy though!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

MNOHoQoVsIUDTV2siAp9Yw.text: On our previous visit to London we dined here for lunch and knew we could get a good meal.  My husband ordered his usual sweet breakfast of pancakes with a side of bacon. I decided to give the Shakshuka a try. Shakshuka is a North African dish of eggs cooked in a tomato sauce with herbs and served with crusty bread. I was hoping to include chorizo but that item contained dairy. The service was friendly, fast and the food was good and filling.

kBYragUd_eEtGF6sZHZ0Fw.text: We were seated quick but the service was soooo slow. The drink order took 25mins to just take it. Then they turned up 15mins later. We finally place our order for dinner close to an hour from being seated. The food showed up and was all wrong. They then fixed it but we never had another order of drinks come by until we were done. My daughter wanted dessert so we decided to get one and that took for ever and in the end she didn't even likeIt.

ya02Bj-k3Ib3iDcaZNjt3w.text: This place is way too overpriced for the blah flavors they have. They're trying to be cultural jack of all trades and it's not working. Abysmal at best. Service is extremely slow. The nachos taste like stale Doritos with canned meat on top. The noodles were dry, and The Couscous was missing the other "Cous"  ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. This place is very over priced for the blah flavors. Trying to be jack of all trades is not working.  Abysmal at best.

52C7AujZNTGOjeBT7HhDTA.text: The people were really nice here, they have avacado, onion rings, ginger smoothie, I don't even remember what else we got but the atmosphere was nice, it was right on the river and we were happy with the entire experience.

qoaDBTXR415S4nju3pTtEg.text: We were enjoying the beautiful weather under the London Eye on Queen's Walk and I had a hankering for something beyond the yogurt truck.  Nice selection of desserts - it was was good and certainly what I expected for a chain restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Rocky Road Sunday - 5.95

JuCQNg8SBjyVzHWsKNXGww.text: This was a tourist trap that we both knew going in but it was late and we were both hungry and there was no wait. Boy did it live up to our low expectations. The food menu in my opinion is all over the place, so i stuck with what i thought was the safe choice which was the burger, wrong. We left both wishing we went someplace else

iiWip4827sluhnS-5JXtKg.text: I met family here after a work. This is a lovely location to have dinner, right on the south bank. We reserved the day before and got a booth for 6 in a nice cosy corner of the restaurant. I didn't have mains with the rest of the family (as I was super full from lunch) but I have eaten at Giraffe before and I like their food. My family had the pasta dishes, which they polished off. I did have the brownie and ice-cream, which was delicious.My 3 year old niece enjoyed the crayons and colouring-in paper. Plus she managed to notice a quirky book shelf right where we were seated and enjoyed looking at the kids books. There was a varied book collection, and the books all in good condition.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Good old doggie bag
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Brownie and ice cream
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Ceiling decor

JZak2IxIYjttPcMlTCTcBQ.text: Terrible service. Really slow and very unfriendly. We both had a chicken curry which was so mild as to be bland even after we added all the hot sauce they included. It also consisted of a bowl of curried potatoes scattered with a sprinkling of chicken that was obviously not cooked in curry. On the side was a price of nana and a bowl of white rice. So not at all a balanced meal, three starches and pinch of chicken. The only saving grace were the cocktails which were really nice. Only once we wanted a second one, it took ages for someone to bring us the list back, so we stole one from another table. Then we waited a really long time for someone to take our order. They also refused to do a discount that was advertised online for the establishment. Very strange. This seams like a spot that relies on tourist... no need for repeat customers.

--VKi-AJ8B2utlRmayJS9g.text: 3.5 stars for Giraffe.This was a nice little place to go to when we were absolutely starving.I ordered the full English breakfast with veggie sausage which was good, but definitely nothing too special. I did appreciate the veggie sausage, but I wouldn't say anything on the plate was bursting with flavor. Nonetheless, it did the trick to curb my hunger before a busy London morning.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. full veggie english breakfast

Wn9VObOLkjd3XD7avXN70Q.text: My friend and I came here while we were walking along the river. The smoothies are fantastic! Even came with a giraffe in it  I had the full English breakfast which was very good, and she had the veggie breakfast which was also good! It came with a veggie sausage, which I had never had and I very much enjoyed it. The service was great as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Full English breakfast

zhrRZp1EZbl4_F0qRDHPfQ.text: I've never been a big fan of giraffe compared with other chain restaurants I have been to but I booked the Christmas menu for 6 uni friends - it looked a bit different - and now I don't think I'll go backWe arrived early so they found us some space at the bar to wait which is good and took our orders for cocktails (average and over priced)We were then seated with only 5 of us there which was fine but as we had already pre ordered food from the Xmas menu they brought it all out! We explained we were still waiting on someone (it was still before our table was booked for) and they were ok with this and took it back but when we got it back it had clearly just been sitting thereMains were ok but a bit bland and dryThen we had another fiasco with pudding where they hadn't put them through so hadn't ordered enoughThey did let us choose of the main menu but their attitude wasn't apologetic at allOverall poorly organised and average foodTo be fair you are not guaranteed a bad meal at this place as some of the food iv had in the past has been ok but I would rather pick somewhere to try than go back to this chain

AdTDCgwxcuqEBno133PPUA.text: Had ginger blast smoothie, chicken katsu noodles.  1. Starter and food took forever to arrive.  2.  Ginger blast was most head instead of juice. 3.  Chicken katsu was moist but meat and noodles were bland and not seasoned at all.  It was a TGIF experience at posh prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Chicken katsu noodles
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom. Ginge blast

M-fHEBwbcZYrLPatkpDfwA.text: A nice spot for a sunny weekend afternoon to sit outside, sip some cocktails, share a platter of food, and watch the world go by. Special mention to the waitress who went out of her way to accommodate my friend who has lots of food allergies, ensuring we could both enjoy the food served.

22pMrBjHF7suhXH6PnUtvw.text: Above average dinner with interesting options especially for vegetarians.   We were seated and served promptly.  Had several cocktails to start with which was tasty, followed by tasty food.  Everyone in my party agreed that the food was great!Would visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Giraffe - London, United Kingdom

viRFRF_H9fRhC1FrMd2pOA.text: The decor is pleasant with a glass front overlooking the river Thames. Wooden tables throughout with a semi open kitchen and tasteful lighting. Outside seating available but not recommended unless it's summer.   My friend had one of the burgers which was presented well, tasted good and was average value for money at £10.95 plus £1.00 to upgrade to sweet potato fries.   My choice was more expensive at £16.95 the same price as a sirloin steak. I ordered smokey BBQ ribs America style. Unfortunately when my meal came out it was just a small rectangle of meat placed on a bone with the tiniest drizzle of BBQ sauce. Definitely not what I was expecting for the price I paid and from the title. Ribs suggests more than one for certain. The skinned fried were adequate and the meat was nothing special. I definitely would not have this dish again and was disappointed though my friend enjoyed hers. I have had breakfast here before which was lovely, so this was a bit of a disappointment. Service was also slow, we were not offered a desert menu and didn't get a single check back. Better luck next time Giraffe!
